trench.js

Summary
trench.js
TrenchClass for drag-snapping regions; called “trenches” as they are long and narrow.

Trench

Class for drag-snapping regions; called “trenches” as they are long and narrow.

Summary
Functions
Trench
Variables
id(integer) The id for the Trench.
Initial parameters
active(boolean) Whether this trench is currently active or not.
position(integer) position is the position that we should snap to.
radius(integer) radius is how far away we should snap from
some Ranges
Functions
setPositionset the trench’s position.
setActiveRangeset the trench’s currently active range.
setWithRectSet the trench’s position using the given rect.
showIf <Trenches.showDebug> is true, we will draw the trench.
hideHide the trench.
rectOverlapsGiven a Rect, compute whether it overlaps with this trench.
ruleOverlapsComputes whether the given “rule” (a line segment, essentially), given by the position and range arguments, overlaps with the current trench.
adjustRangeIfInterceptComputes whether the given boundary (given as a position and its active range), perpendicular to the trench, intercepts the trench or not.
calculateActiveRangeComputes and sets the activeRange for the trench, based on the Groups around.

Functions

Trench

var Trench = function(element,
xory,
type,
edge)

Parameters

elementthe DOM element for Item (Group or TabItem) from which the trench is projected
xoryeither “x” or “y”: whether the trench’s position is along the x- or y-axis.  In other words, if “x”, the trench is vertical; if “y”, the trench is horizontal.
typeeither “border” or “guide”.  Border trenches mark the border of an Item.  Guide trenches extend out (unless they are intercepted) and act as “guides”.
edgewhich edge of the Item that this trench corresponds to.  Either “top”, “left”, “bottom”, or “right”.

Variables

id

this.id

(integer) The id for the Trench.  Set sequentially via <Trenches.nextId>

Initial parameters

element(DOMElement)
xory(string) “x” or “y”
type(string) “border” or “guide”
edge(string) “top”, “left”, “bottom”, or “right”

active

this.active

(boolean) Whether this trench is currently active or not.  Basically every trench aside for those projected by the Item currently being dragged all become active.

position

this.position

(integer) position is the position that we should snap to.

radius

this.radius

(integer) radius is how far away we should snap from

some Ranges

range(Range) explicit range; this is along the transverse axis
minRange(Range) the minimum active range
activeRange(Range) the currently active range

Functions

setPosition

setPosition: function Trench_setPos(position,
range,
minRange)

set the trench’s position.

Parameters

position(integer) px center position of the trench
range(Range) the explicit active range of the trench
minRange(Range) the minimum range of the trench

setActiveRange

setActiveRange: function Trench_setActiveRect(activeRange)

set the trench’s currently active range.

Parameters

activeRange(Range)

setWithRect

setWithRect: function Trench_setWithRect(rect)

Set the trench’s position using the given rect.  We know which side of the rect we should match because we’ve already recorded this information in edge.

Parameters

rect(Rect)

show

show: function Trench_show()

If <Trenches.showDebug> is true, we will draw the trench.

Active portions are drawn with 0.5 opacity.  If active is false, the entire trench will be very translucent.

hide

hide: function Trench_hide()

Hide the trench.

rectOverlaps

rectOverlaps: function Trench_rectOverlaps(rect,
assumeConstantSize,
keepProportional)

Given a Rect, compute whether it overlaps with this trench.  If it does, return an adjusted (“snapped”) Rect; if it does not overlap, simply return false.

Note that simply overlapping is not all that is required to be affected by this function.  Trenches can only affect certain edges of rectangles... for example, a “left”-edge guide trench should only affect left edges of rectangles.  We don’t snap right edges to left-edged guide trenches.  For border trenches, the logic is a bit different, so left snaps to right and top snaps to bottom.

Parameters

rect(Rect) the rectangle in question
assumeConstantSize(boolean) whether the rect’s dimensions are sacred or not
keepProportional(boolean) if we are allowed to change the rect’s size, whether the dimensions should scaled proportionally or not.

Returns

falseif rect does not overlap with this trench
newRect(Rect) an adjusted version of rect, if it is affected by this trench

ruleOverlaps

ruleOverlaps: function Trench_ruleOverlaps(position,
range)

Computes whether the given “rule” (a line segment, essentially), given by the position and range arguments, overlaps with the current trench.  Note that this function assumes that the rule and the trench are in the same direction: both horizontal, or both vertical.

Parameters

position(integer) a position in px
range(Range) the rule’s range

adjustRangeIfIntercept

adjustRangeIfIntercept: function Trench_adjustRangeIfIntercept(position,
range)

Computes whether the given boundary (given as a position and its active range), perpendicular to the trench, intercepts the trench or not.  If it does, it returns an adjusted Range for the trench.  If not, it returns false.

Parameters

position(integer) the position of the boundary
range(Range) the target’s range, on the trench’s transverse axis

calculateActiveRange

calculateActiveRange: function Trench_calculateActiveRange()

Computes and sets the activeRange for the trench, based on the Groups around.  This makes it so trenches’ active ranges don’t extend through other groups.

Trenches

Singelton for managing all Trenches.

Summary
Variables
snapping preferences; used to break ties in snapping.
Functions
getByIdReturn the specified Trench.
registerRegister a new Trench and returns the resulting Trench ID.
unregisterUnregister one or more Trenches.
activateOthersTrenchesActivate all Trenches other than those projected by the current element.
disactivateAfter activateOthersTrenches, disactivates all the Trenches again.
snapUsed to “snap” an object’s bounds to active trenches and to the edge of the window.
showTrench.show all Trenches.
toggleShownToggle <Trenches.showDebug> and trigger Trenches.show

Variables

snapping preferences; used to break ties in snapping.

preferTop(boolean) prefer snapping to the top to the bottom
preferLeft(boolean) prefer snapping to the left to the right

Functions

getById

getById: function Trenches_getById(id)

Return the specified Trench.

Parameters

id(integer)

register

register: function Trenches_register(element,
xory,
type,
edge)

Register a new Trench and returns the resulting Trench ID.

Parameters

See the constructor Trench.Trench’s parameters.

Returns

id(boolean) the new Trench’s ID.

unregister

unregister: function Trenches_unregister(ids)

Unregister one or more Trenches.

Parameters

ids(integer) a single Trench ID or (array) a list of Trench IDs.

activateOthersTrenches

activateOthersTrenches: function Trenches_activateOthersTrenches(element)

Activate all Trenches other than those projected by the current element.

Parameters

element(DOMElement) the DOM element of the Item being dragged or resized.

disactivate

disactivate: function Trenches_disactivate()

After activateOthersTrenches, disactivates all the Trenches again.

snap

snap: function Trenches_snap(rect,
assumeConstantSize,
keepProportional)

Used to “snap” an object’s bounds to active trenches and to the edge of the window.  If the meta key is down (<Key.meta>), it will not snap but will still enforce the rect not leaving the safe bounds of the window.

Parameters

rect(Rect) the object’s current bounds
assumeConstantSize(boolean) whether the rect’s dimensions are sacred or not
keepProportional(boolean) if we are allowed to change the rect’s size, whether the dimensions should scaled proportionally or not.

Returns

(<Rect>)the updated bounds, if they were updated
falseif the bounds were not updated

show

show: function Trenches_show()

Trench.show all Trenches.

toggleShown

toggleShown: function Trenches_toggleShown()

Toggle <Trenches.showDebug> and trigger Trenches.show
